events.title: Prohibition Ends in the United States
events.description: The 21st Amendment to the U.S. Constitution was ratified, repealing the 18th Amendment and ending the national prohibition on alcohol.
events.significance: Marked the end of a 13-year nationwide ban on alcohol, significantly impacting American social and economic life.

events.title: Franklin D. Roosevelt Elected President of the United States
events.description: Franklin D. Roosevelt was elected for his first term as the 32nd President of the United States, beginning the New Deal era.
events.significance: Initiated numerous reforms to address the Great Depression and shaped modern American political history.

events.title: Christopher Columbus Lands in Hispaniola
events.description: During his first voyage, Columbus landed on the island now known as Hispaniola, marking one of the first European contacts with the Americas.
events.significance: Pivotal moment in European exploration and colonization of the New World.

events.title: Birth of Walt Disney
events.description: Walt Disney, American entrepreneur, animator, and film producer, was born on this day.
events.significance: Founder of The Walt Disney Company, influential in shaping modern animation and entertainment.

events.title: Abolitionist John Brown Executed
events.description: John Brown, an American abolitionist who led the raid on Harpers Ferry to initiate a slave revolt, was executed by hanging.
events.significance: His actions and death intensified tensions leading up to the American Civil War.
